Reviews.Title: I'd give it more stars if I could.
Reviews.Author: ZDJ
Reviews.Content: As I was looking for an Android smartphone, I was looking at the Galaxy S3 and S4, but didn't want to lock into a long contract, and didn't like the price tag for  buying one outright. Through many google searches, came across the Blu Products phones. After researching their existing product lines as well as the new lines about to launch, I concluded that the Life Play X was the device for me, and was able to order one as soon as they became available. I really like the fact that they are "unlocked", so I can use an MVNO and get better pricing/support than from T. Specs-wise, it falls into a happy medium between the S3 and S4.Pros: Unlocked. Comes with a case/cover that doesn't add much bulk to it, but will help protect it from drops. Both front and back cameras work well. Plenty of onboard storage with 16G flash. Micro-SD card slot for more storage. Good processor, device is very responsive. Bright, clear screen. Passes the feel test - does not feel cheap, nice and solid. Wifi works with no issues. GPS worked well with the little testing I did.Cons: My wife liked it so well, she claimed the first one I got, so I had to order and wait for a second one to be shipped. The speaker and headphone volumes could be a little louder, but I am getting older and probably losing a little hearing, so they're really not bad. Would be nice if it had 2GB of memory instead of 1GB, but still plenty to get by. No 4G LTE support, but 3G HSPA+ is going to be around for quite awhile, so enough cell data speed for anything I need to do.As far as battery life, this is my first smartphone, so don't have a frame of reference. I've also been playing with it a lot, trying apps, etc. It easily gets through one day with what I'm doing with a lot to spare, though, so it's good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: life play x, a lot more than i expected
Reviews.Author: aaron
Reviews.Content: firstly the shipping took a while, for some reason amazon took a long to time to accept payment, only when i contacted them to complain they upgraded me to free one day shipping. other than that its all good.pors: the display is great, i cant tell the difference between this and the S3 honestly, also the rear camera is good, not as good as an iphone or lumia ofc but for the price it is excellent, apps run without lag and screens scroll smooth. the dual sim configuration works great, you get to choose which sim for data, messages, voice calls and video calls. the battery life is fine, i easily get through a day with lots more to go. the stock browser is fast on wificons: there is only 9.8GB available instead of the 16GB advertised. there is no led indicator so u always have to unlock the phone to check for updates. the front camera is slow and a bit blurry.other than the few cons listed above, i would give it 5 stars but this is only based on 2 days of use, so il update after a month or so

Reviews.Title: Decent phone
Reviews.Author: Brigham Ray
Reviews.Content: The phone works great and comes with headphones and a case which  give it 4 stars. It needs better software stability for 5 stars. As far as software issues go, the phone will randomly power on and off (which drains a signifigant amount of battery after a few days) and sometimes the touch screen will become erratic. Another bug, something that really bugs me, is that the input method will change back to the 4.2 keyboard after powering it back on, even if I specifically change the input method to something else. I also wish the phone would become android 4.4 already so these annoying bugs could be fixed!

Reviews.Title: The best phone
Reviews.Author: Sergio Leon
Reviews.Content: I had a Blu Life Play and was totally the best around, then i saw this upgraded version and decided to upgrade and sold the old one. This phone is as good as expected, great processor, great graphics, great camera and a lot of storage for apps and files. The manufacturer confirmed update by May so this phone have it all. It even comes with a gel case and screen protector installed.

Reviews.Title: An excellent/improved Android dual-SIM smartphone from BLU
Reviews.Author: poofypuppy
Reviews.Content: For $215 or so, this is an excellent dual-SIM Android smartphone and is the second such phone from BLU that I've purchased.  Compared with my last one (Studio 5.3 S), the Life Play X has more internal memory (16GB vs 4GB) and better (720 x 1280) screen resolution, yet a smaller/lighter form factor.  Despite having only an 1800 mAh battery, battery life is good assuming light to moderate use.  This Life Play X L102A model is tailored to AT&T; GSM in the USA covering the HSDPA 850/1900MHz bands.  Setup of this phone was really easy, just popped in my work and personal SIMs (and added WiFi password for home), and was off and running with cellular data and everything (whereas I had to spend a fair amount of time to research/configure mobile network settings on the old BLU, which was a bit of a hassle).This is probably one of the best (if not the best) dual-SIM smartphones for use with AT&T; in the USA.  There may be better dual-SIM phones out there, but not at this price point at this time (March 2014).  I'm sure BLU will come out with something even better next year, but for now this phone is the bomb.

Reviews.Title: Great Value For Money
Reviews.Author: Darius F. Bharat
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best phones on the market to buy if you don't want to get tied to a contract and looking for a good dual sim phone.The phone is lightweight yet solid in build. Feels like a premium brand name phone.It is fast and responsive to the touch and have some really nice custom features without taking away from the base android experience.The camera is not the best 8mp smartphone camera but it is still far better that what most phones more expensive than this one offers.I would recommend this to anyone on a budget looking for a good phone. And, coming soon to a Blu near you: Android Kit Kat!

Reviews.Title: After a while...
Reviews.Author: Jean Laurent
Reviews.Content: With no discussion: This is a very great phone! After an extensive use all the systems work fine. Great speed, great overall performance. A best buy.

Reviews.Title: Very Sleek Small form Phone
Reviews.Author: RDamery
Reviews.Content: Nice screen and responsive.  Phone arrived with loose volume button so I had to send it back.  Phone is very light and I actually prefer the way the Life One feels.  I bought the Life One M for about the same money and prefer it to this phone even though I had to add a micro sd card for more storage.

Reviews.Title: This Phone is Awesome
Reviews.Author: Axedon "Axe"
Reviews.Content: I just got this phone for my daughter as an upgrade, play around with it quite a bit, this phone looks and feels great, the screen is very nice, bright and colorful, yet natural. I like it better than my SG III, is faster and sounds better, everything about it is smoother, the only thing I'm not sure if is better are, call quality, not sure if it has gorilla glass, no 4G LTE and if it will last, for $180 this a great phone, I really think it is better than my SG III, duel Sim card, great for oversea, come with a gel cover, screen protector, if you want a great unlock phone and a great price, I don't think anything can beat Blu.....

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone
Reviews.Author: G. Craig "brothergc"
Reviews.Content: I been using this phone for a few months and every bit as good as those higher end brand names IMO . You might have to spend some time with Your carrier though . While mine worked out of the box for calls sending message picks was a challenge as I had to get all the settings from consumer cellier and manually enter those in . But once done all was well and I happy . Saved a bundle over using all those contract , high end phone plans

Reviews.Title: Rewiew BLPX L102A (Movistar Movilnet ) Dual Sim Venezuela
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: 05.02.2014 - 3 weeks UseWhy did you choose this ratingGeneral My rating for this phone is 4 stars , I'm pretty satisfied with the item overall, for the price I was quite impressed .Features:4.2.1 ( Upgradable to Kit Kat in June) : Android version . Almost Pure Android Nexus type .Display: 4.7 320 ppi IPS . 720x1280 HDModel L102A Dual Sim (Works perfectly for Vzla Movilnet Movistar 3G and 3G, only one at a time ) .Processor: 1.5 Ghz Quadcord Mediatek MT6589 MTK (ARM Cortex- A7)GPU: PowerVR SGX 544MP (Same S3 and S4 mini) .1Gb Ram - Real 967MB16GB of internal memory:      6.90 Gb for the system .      9.10 Gb of capacity for the phone.SD memory up to 64GB .8MP Camera Main ( Average 5 of 10) .Front Camera 2MP (Mala 2 of 10) .It has FM radio (very good).WIFIGPS, Compass .Speaker ( Poor 5 of 10) .3.5 mm Audio ( Only works well with headphones Blu )Battery 1800ma ( Decent 8 or 10 hours of continuous use Wifi , dual sim , multi-tasking ) .Sensors: Accelerometer, Magnetic , Orientation, Proximity and Light.PROS : Fast, beautiful, lightweight , all a Midrange Smartphone or Android entry . Excellent multitasking, Dual sim is excellent in Venezuela , works really well , easy to use and set up , you can turn a line or choose a favorite , you can also choose the data usage, this is very good for people who have 2 lines especially a personal and working . In his suit case , charger, USB cable , earphones , skin protector, and plastic liner . HD video playback is amazing, the quality of the screen seems a High Standard . Almost pure Android as nexus , customization layer BLU nor note , only certain colors.Cons: Speaker very low , low headset ( headphones not work another brand is heard 1 of 10) , in the section of camera 5 or 10 And Something I really do not like is that the screen feels pretty fragile in comparison. with Gorilla Glass , pressing long the pixels become distorted, but in normal use all goes well .Performance :Antutu Benchmark . 16400 Just below S3.With Vellamo :1) HTML . 5: Just above the 1623 S3: 1615, Nexus 7:1564 , 4:1446 Nexus2) Metal: 545 Just above the S3 . 542, 7:381 Nexus , One X : 438Note: The USB cable that brings must be replaced in many forums comment that USB charging port damage while this cable brings fasteners which must be some force to remove the cable after charging , so I recommend using USB cable without these bras .Who would you recommend this productPeople with Just $ 200 budget , this phone is ideal, the Motorola Moto G is also very good have those 2 options , I chose the BLPX for additional in the box, Dual Sim and SD memory is sensational.In two months I update my comments.

Reviews.Title: Works Awesome
Reviews.Author: Syed
Reviews.Content: With some small tweaks I can be an amazing device. Only negative is the headset  issue; see my request to BLU support below:BLU:I have a question about headsets. I tried a few others apart from the original one that came with my device but they all have poor audio quality/volume. I did some research and found that only a certain type works on this device. Can you give a technical spec for the type of compatible headset for this device. The original earbud that came is OK but its difficult for my ear and becomes sweaty and slips off easily (doesn't fit well). I would prefer to get the type that rests inside the outer ear and not sticks into it.RegardsSyed Ali

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: AshleyBD
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this phone! I'm going to try to come back and write a longer review when I'm not lazy but know that this a really good phone and they are adding new accessories everyday. A lot of the accessories do not have reviews but that is just because the products are new and not as popular as samsung or iphone products. I for one just ordered the new "black/black hybrid case" they have for the Blu Life Play and hopefully it'll be here soon and I can review that as well.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: joe paula
Reviews.Content: Battery life is good and video quality is great. This phone is fast and not complicated to use. If I have a negative it is that the ear piece gets hot on a long call, other than that it is a good deal for the money

Reviews.Title: very good phone
Reviews.Author: Pedro Arias
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone for the price paid, better than I expected. very good camera resolution and excellent color screen level.Thin Cell and excellent little weight to carry and everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Really good and cheap
Reviews.Author: Madison
Reviews.Content: Pros: dual sim(micro/standard SIM cards), unlocked, great battery life, screen responsive, fast processor, no bloat ware, free headphones(good quality, like beats), free case, free screen protector, very light, feels nice in the hand, doesn't feel cheap, 64 gig expandable storage(I have not yet confirmed yet)Cons: camera(not as good as my iphone),internal storage is really 6 gigs,its been a week since i had it starting on feb 2,2014. So I will update again at the end of the monthUPDATE!!! 3/14/2014Major problem with bluetooth and pandora. Whenever i connect it with my speaker for the shower it freezes right in the middle of the song and pauses it for whatever reason and its so annoying. Its only happening with pandora, im not sure about the other services. Also if you have a tmobile sim in it for whatever whack job reason its really acts like its retarded driving you all over the place. im not sure if its the network or the phone but it doesnt play nice with tmobile and its gps unit. i have not tried att yet but they are expensive This is why i changed it from 4 to 3 stars overall its a good phone for its priceUPDATE!!!!!4/17/2014Ok the major problems are now the earphones quality when you use other earphones because its bad and still the extremely horrible part of this phone is that the gps software is load of crap and not good when navigating. So im now degrading my 3 stars to 2 stars.This phone is great for calling, texting, mobiile hotspot, internet browsing, apps, and its unlocked but thats it so this is my review of the phone

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: The phone is very nice until I tried to connect to the Internet...did not do anything only connected in wifi.
